characterfile.write(p.buydelay, 0, p.toString().length());
characterfile.newLine();

characterfile.write(p.buydelay, 0, p.toString().length());
|

Still can’t get past this error

item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

ps it should of been buydelay, but I guess it doesn’t work that way.
Make a string reference out of the integer, e.g. String s = p.buydelay; then get the length of that to write.

item.title: [PI] Timer Saving
item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

Delta refers to save params as ‘tokens’ for some reason, to save the timer you could add under one of the writelines

characterfile.write("character-timer1 = ", 0, 20); characterfile.write(p.timer1, 0, p.timer1.length()); characterfile.newLine();

Then find the loading method, and compare the code to load the data.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Timer Saving
item.dc:creator: @skillingman8 skillingman8
item.description:
@skillingman8 wrote:

I don’t understand what you mean, by save as token brah.

public static boolean saveGame(Client p) { if(!p.saveFile || p.newPlayer || !p.saveCharacter) { //System.out.println("first"); return false; } if(p.playerName == null || Server.playerHandler.players[p.playerId] == null) { //System.out.println("second"); return false; } p.playerName = p.playerName2; int tbTime = (int)(p.teleBlockDelay - System.currentTimeMillis() + p.teleBlockLength); if(tbTime > 300000 || tbTime < 0){ tbTime = 0; } 
	BufferedWriter characterfile = null;
	try {
		characterfile = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter("./Data/characters/"+p.playerName+".txt"));
		
		/*ACCOUNT*/
		characterfile.write("[ACCOUNT]", 0, 9);
		characterfile.newLine();
		characterfile.write("character-username = ", 0, 21);
		characterfile.write(p.playerName, 0, p.playerName.length());
		characterfile.newLine();
		characterfile.write("character-password = ", 0, 21);
		characterfile.write(p.playerPass, 0, p.playerPass.length());
		characterfile.newLine();
		characterfile.newLine();
		
		characterfile.newLine();
		characterfile.newLine();
		characterfile.write("Bankpins are fun", 0, 16);

etc…

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Timer Saving
item.dc:creator: @skillingman8 skillingman8
item.description:
@skillingman8 wrote:

Thanks for leading me in the right way, this is the save on disconnect code,

public void destruct() { PlayerSave.saveGame(this); if(disconnected == true) { saveCharacter = true; } if(disconnected == true){ getTradeAndDuel().declineTrade(); } if(session == null) return; PlayerSave.saveGame(this); if (clanId >= 0) Server.clanChat.leaveClan(playerId, clanId); getPA().removeFromCW(); if (inPits) { Server.fightPits.removePlayerFromPits(playerId); } Misc.println("[DEREGISTERED]: "+playerName+""); PlayerSave.saveGame(this); saveCharacter = true; HostList.getHostList().remove(session); disconnected = true; session.close(); session = null; inStream = null; outStream = null; isActive = false; buffer = null; super.destruct(); }

Can someone spoon feed this to me, ahah

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Timer Saving
item.dc:creator: @Repu Repu
item.description:
@Repu wrote:

Save the time as a ‘token’ in the character field, for delta search for ‘character-name’ in the client class to find the saving and loading player methods.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Timer Saving
item.dc:creator: @skillingman8 skillingman8
item.description:
@skillingman8 wrote:

Hello,
Could someone help me add saving to timer so you can’t log out then login and click the object again?

case 239: final long deltaTime = (System.currentTimeMillis() - c.buydelay) / 864000; if (deltaTime >= 864000) { c.getItems().addItem(620,1200); c.sendMessage("You Have gotten 1200 tickets."); c.buydelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); } else { //<<< When I add that c.sendMessage("Time: " + deltaTime + ""); c.sendMessage("Please Wait 24 hours to get tickets."); c.buydelay = System.currentTimeMillis(); } break;
